EnrichedPH API Reference¶

The EnrichedPH module¶

class enriched_ph.EnrichedPH.PCF(X, dmat=None)¶

An object for persistent cohomology analysis of heterogeneous data.

assemble_boundary_matrix(dim)¶

Construct the coboundary matrices of the final complex

Parameters

dim (int) – dimension k, C^{k-1} -> C^k

collect_nd_simplices()¶

Collect the simplices of different dimensions separately.

compute_enriched_barcode(f, dim)¶

Generate the enriched barcodes

Returns:

  1. the original barcode,

  2. the filtration values examined for each bar,

  3. the corresponding function values for each bar.

Parameters

f – the information on the nodes

“type f: class:numpy.ndarray :param dim: dimension of barcode :type dim: int

compute_volume(uniform=False)¶

Compute volumes for each simplex.

Parameters

uniform (boolean, default to False.) – whether use unit weight for all simplices, if not, geometric volume is used.

construct_smoothed_cocycles(dim, thrsh, lap_type, nsp=None, lsp=None)¶

Construct smoothed cocycles.

Parameters

  • dim (int) – dimension

  • thrsh (float) – only bars longer than threshold is considered and smoothed

  • lap_type (str) – the type of Laplacian to measure smoothness. 1. ‘combinatorial_full’, weighted combinatorial Laplacian; 2. ‘combinatorial_low’, the lower combinatorial laplacian

  • nsp (int) – number of points separated equally to take for each bar

  • lsp (float) – the stepsize for taking points for each bar

construct_weighted_combinatorial_laplacian(dim, filt_value, type)¶

Construct weighted combinatorial laplacian

Parameters

  • dim (int) – the dimension of the laplacian

  • filt_value (float) – the filtration value for constructing the matrix

  • type (str) – full laplacian or only the lower part

filtration(rule, nd=None, rips_max=None)¶

Run the filtration through dionysus.

Parameters

  • rule (str) – the filtration rules. 1. ‘alpha’, alpha complex; 2. ‘rips_euc’, rips complex with Euclidean distance of point cloud; 3. ‘rips_dmat’, rips complex on the distance matrix)

  • nd (int, defaults to dimension of X) – max dimension of filtration

  • rips_max (float) – threshold value for rips filtration if rips is used

pcoh(prime=547)¶

Run persistent cohomology through dionysus

Parameters

prime (int, defaults to 547) – the prime number for the coefficient field

plot_enriched_barcode(barcode, filt_values, feature_values, dims=None, vminmax=None, colorbar_ticks=None)¶

Plot the enriched barcode

Parameters

  • barcode (class:numpy.ndarray) – an array of original barcode

  • filt_values (class:numpy.ndarray) – the filtration values examined for each bar

  • feature_values (class:numpy.ndarray) – the value reflecting the additional information

smooth(dim, cocycle, filt_value, lap_type)¶

Generate smoothed cocycles

Parameters

  • dim (int) – dimension of the cocycle

  • cocycle ([list of scalars, list of tuples]) – the original representative cocycle with coefficients and simplices

  • filt_value (float) – the filtration value

  • lap_type (str) – the type of Laplacian to measure smoothness. 1. ‘combinatorial_full’, combinatorial Laplacian, 2. ‘combinatorial_low’, the lower combinatorial Laplacian,

enriched_ph.EnrichedPH.generate_coulomb_potential_enriched_barcode(pcoh_result, atm_pos, charges)¶

This generates the results for protein electrostatic example.

enriched_ph.EnrichedPH.volume(Points)¶

Computes volume For triangle: Heron’s formula For tetrahedron: Wikipedia: tetrahedron For higher dimension: Cayley-Menger Determinant

enriched_ph.EnrichedPH.weighted_wasserstein_distance(barcode1, barcode2, alphas, p)¶

Computes a sequence of the wasserstein distances.

Returns:

a collection of the two components (barcode and the function) w.r.t. the given alphas

Parameters

  • barcode1 (class:numpy.ndarray) – enriched barcode with the columns being birth, death, and the non-geometric information

  • barcode2 (class:numpy.ndarray) – the other enriched barcode to compare with

  • alphas (class:numpy.ndarray) – the weights to consider in [0,1], when alpha=0, it returns the p-Wasserstein distance for traditional barcodes

  • p (float) – the power for the Wasserstein distance
